article: Back in the fifteenth century in Nuremberg lived a family with eighteen children. They were so poor that two children, who wanted to pursue their talent for  _  knew their father would never be  _  able to send either of them to Nuremberg to study at the Academy. So they tossed a coin. Albrecht Durer, the younger,  _  the toss and went off to Nuremberg. Albert went down into the dangerous  _  and for the next four years, financed his brother, who did so well that his works were even better than those of most of his  _  . By the time he graduated, he was beginning to earn  _  fees by drawing for wealthy people. When the young artist returned home, at dinner he drank a  _  to his beloved brother for the years of  hard work  that had enabled him to fulfill his  _  .He said, "Albert, my blessed brother, now it is your  _  to go to Nuremberg to pursue your dream, and I will take care of you." With tears in his eyes, Albert held his hands close to his right cheek and said, "No, brother, I cannot go. Look... look what four years in the mines have done to my  _  !The bones in every finger have been  _  at least once. Lately I have been suffering from arthritis so badly in my right hand that I cannot even hold a  _  to return your toast, much less make delicate lines with a pen or a brush. No, brother..., for me it is too  _  ." Deeply moved, Albrecht painstakingly drew his brother's  _  hands with palms together and thin fingers stretched skyward. He called his powerful drawing  _  "Hands", to which the entire world immediately opened their hearts and later they  _  it " the Praying Hands". The next time when you see a copy of that  _  creation, take a second look. Let it be your  _  , if you still need one, that no one ever makes it  _  !
